byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris.
byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and AURELIEN BREEDEN

abstract: French leaders force measure through lower house of Parliament that would permit more stores to open on Sundays; move reflects rift in nation over balancing worker protections against economic growth.
lead_paragraph: The lower house of Parliament is to debate a proposal that would allow stores in tourist zones and other outlets to offer all-week shopping more often.

headline.main: French Leaders Set Up Showdown in Forcing Measure to Widen Sunday Shopping
headline.print_headline: French Leaders Set Up Showdown in Forcing Measure to Widen Sunday Shopping

snippet: The lower house of Parliament is to debate a proposal that would allow stores in tourist zones and other outlets to offer all-week shopping more often.
